title: AI-assisted QA triage → faster bug turnaround
problem: Bugs were arriving with inconsistent repro steps and scattered context, slowing fixes and making releases riskier.
approach: Standardized an intake format and used AI to extract: steps, expected vs actual, environment, and suspected component
Added a lightweight checklist so humans confirm the critical details before handoff
Generated a short “next action” summary for each ticket
evidence_snippets: “Repro steps are now consistent across tickets; we stopped guessing.”
“The summary tells me exactly where to start looking.”
prompt_template:
You are a QA triage assistant.

Given the bug report text, extract:
- Minimal repro steps (numbered)
- Expected vs actual
- Environment clues (browser/OS/build)
- Suspected area (component/page)
- Missing info (ask 2-4 targeted questions)

Bug report:
{{BUG_TEXT}}
short_script: I used AI to turn messy bug reports into a consistent triage package: clean repro steps, environment, and missing questions—so engineers start fixing immediately instead of doing archaeology.

title: Reusable prompt pack for stakeholder updates
problem: Weekly updates were time-consuming and varied in quality depending on who wrote them.
approach:
Built a repeatable prompt template that converts raw bullet notes into a crisp stakeholder update with risks, next steps, and asks.
- Added a 'no fabrication' constraint
- Included a short TL;DR and optional deeper dive section
evidence_snippets: “This reads like a real PM update, not a brain dump.”
prompt_template:
You are a concise, high-trust status update writer.

Rules:
- Do not invent outcomes.
- If something is unclear, mark it as 'Unknown'.

Turn these raw notes into:
1) TL;DR (3 bullets)
2) Progress
3) Risks/blocks
4) Next steps
5) Asks

Raw notes:
{{NOTES}}
short_script: I made a prompt-based update template that turns raw notes into a consistent weekly stakeholder report—with explicit non-fabrication rules—so updates are fast and trustworthy.

title: UI copy polish pass with AI—fewer ambiguous labels
problem: Several UI labels were ambiguous and caused repeat questions (“What does this do?”).
approach: Collected the top confusing labels from support notes
Used AI to propose variants constrained to existing intent and UI space
Reviewed and selected final copy with a quick sanity check
evidence_snippets: “The new labels are much clearer—no more guessing.”
prompt_template:
You are a UX writer.

Given UI text and context, propose 5 alternatives.
Constraints:
- Keep intent identical.
- Max length: {{MAX_CHARS}} chars.
- Avoid jargon.

Context:
{{CONTEXT}}

Original:
{{TEXT}}
short_script: I used AI as a UX writing partner to generate constrained label alternatives, then picked the clearest ones—improving comprehension without changing product behavior.
